Class Board

java.lang.Object
  Board

public class Board
extends java.lang.Object

The Board class, as oppsoed to the Interface class, handles functionality - storing the checkers on the board, allowing users to make moves, setting up the board as either a new or loaded game, checking for valid moves and winning conditions; While it doesn't store any information about Players themselves, it is the class that spawns them and can determine which one should go first.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Mikolaj Gackowski

Constructor Summary
Board()
          Constructor for objects of class Board, which also initialises the default positions of checkers.
 
Method Summary
 boolean checkForWin()
          Checks if the current player's score has reached zero and displays the result screen if it has.
 void determineFirstPlayer()
          Prompts the players to roll the dice and assign priority to one over the other.
 int[] getCheckers()
          Accessor method that returns the current position and colour of all checkers on the board.
 boolean loadGame()
          Reads from a text file in order to restore a previously saved game; updates the variables in the program to match the ones in the text file.
 boolean makeMove()
          Allows the user to make a single, valid move with a checker in response to what colour the user is playing as and what dice have been rolled; it will not allow to make a move that is illegal.
 void newGame()
          Prepares the board for a new game, creating two new players, prompting for names and filling the field[] array with default checker values.
 void saveGame()
          Saves the information that can be used to restore an ongoing game to a text file; that includes checker positioning, player names, scores, and an information which one is active at the moment.
 void setCheckers(int triangle, int number)
          Mutator method that amends the data on current checker positions.

checkForWin

public boolean checkForWin()
Checks if the current player's score has reached zero and displays the result screen if it has.

Parameters:
None -
Returns:
True if one of the players won.

determineFirstPlayer

public void determineFirstPlayer()
Prompts the players to roll the dice and assign priority to one over the other.

Parameters:
None -

getCheckers

public int[] getCheckers()
Accessor method that returns the current position and colour of all checkers on the board.

Parameters:
None -
Returns:
array of checkers: field[number], 0 and 25 represent bar

loadGame

public boolean loadGame()
Reads from a text file in order to restore a previously saved game; updates the variables in the program to match the ones in the text file.

Parameters:
None -
Returns:
None

makeMove

public boolean makeMove()
Allows the user to make a single, valid move with a checker in response to what colour the user is playing as and what dice have been rolled; it will not allow to make a move that is illegal.

Parameters:
None -
Returns:
An indication if a move was made

newGame

public void newGame()
Prepares the board for a new game, creating two new players, prompting for names and filling the field[] array with default checker values.

Parameters:
None -

saveGame

public void saveGame()
Saves the information that can be used to restore an ongoing game to a text file; that includes checker positioning, player names, scores, and an information which one is active at the moment.

Parameters:
None -
